etymologies: mid 16th century (denoting a canary): from French, ‘canary’, of unknown ultimate origin

definitions: a small Eurasian and North African finch related to the canary, with a short bill and typically streaky plumage.

notes.text: Genus Serinus, family Fringillidae: several species, in particular the European serin (S. serinus)

shortDefinitions: small Eurasian and North African finch related to canary
